page.title: 06THE HERDSMAN'S DAY
page.content: The typical Herdsmans day starts when he gets up at 5.15am,he gets dressed, goes down stairs and puts his boots on. He goes into the milking parlour and gets it ready for the cows.Each cows give about 8 gallons of milk a day.Then he takes the cows into the field so he can get on with his job of cleaning the parlour with the scraper.Then he will wash the milk machines and turn the cooler off.The milk goes through tubes into the tank. Then he will come in and have his breakfast at about 8.00am.He will then feed the calves and the bulls with cake and hay and bed them with straw. After this he will go and help with other jobs like haymaking until 1.00pm.The cows have to be milked again in the afternoon and the milk stored until the next morning when the tanker comes to collect it.
